snippet: These are giddy days for the Cubs, not just because they are winning but because of how. For a franchise stalked by history, everything feels new and fresh.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column says that Chicago Cubs, busy preparing for National League Championship Series, have most imposing young lineup in Major League Baseball; notes that Cubs, led by players mostly in their 20s, won their last eight games of regular season and now have won four of five in playoffs.
lead_paragraph: These are giddy days for the Cubs, not just because they are winning but because of how. For a franchise stalked by history, everything feels new and fresh.

headline.main: Fortunately for Cubs, Their Young Stars Are Making Their Own History
headline.print_headline: Cubs, Full of Power and Promise, Shrug Off History’s Burden
